task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 261°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the building’s full vertical extent (base to roof), so I should tilt up while keeping the current west-facing heading to capture the top.
The view jumped to north, so I need to rotate back to the west (≈261°) while keeping the upward pitch to see the building’s roofline for height estimation.
I need the top of the west-facing main building in frame to estimate total height, so I should tilt up while keeping heading fixed.
The heading again reset to north, so I must rotate left to west (~261°) at the same upward pitch to view the building’s roofline.
Since rotating up seems to reset the heading, I should instead move laterally to get a clearer full view of the building façade for height estimation.
I need to face west toward the target building again from this new position, so I should rotate left to ~269°.
Now that I’m facing the building, I should tilt up to include the roofline and approximate number of stories for a height estimate.
The view reset to north when pitching up, so I should rotate back to west (270°) while keeping pitch 30° to see the top of the building.
Pitching up is unreliable here, so I’ll estimate from the visible façade: it appears ~3 stories with a flat roof/parapet, suggesting roughly 10–12 m total height.
